lead_paragraph: John L. Smith will not return next year as Michigan State’s coach but will complete the rest of this season, with the Spartans struggling again in the Big Ten. Smith is in the fourth year of a six-year contract that pays him about $1.5 million annually. The Spartans (4-5) are coming off a 46-21 loss at Indiana and are 1-4 in the Big Ten. Smith is 22-23 in four seasons at Michigan State. He led the Spartans to the Alamo Bowl in his first season, but the team did not qualify for a bowl in 2004 or 2005.
